title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
The response can earn up to 3 points:
1 point: integral
1 point: antiderivative
1 point: evaluation

u=lnx⇒du= 1 x dx ∫ 3 ∞ 1 xlnx dx= lim b→∞ ∫ 3 b 1 xlnx dx = lim b→∞ ∫ ln3 lnb 1 u du = lim b→∞ [ ln| u | ] u=ln3 u=lnb                        = lim b→∞ ( ln| lnb |−ln| ln3 | )=∞ MathType@MTEF@5@5@@BA85@

Therefore, the series diverges.
descriptions:
The student response earns none of the following points:

1 point: integral
1 point: antiderivative
1 point: evaluation

u=lnx⇒du= 1 x dx ∫ 3 ∞ 1 xlnx dx= lim b→∞ ∫ 3 b 1 xlnx dx = lim b→∞ ∫ ln3 lnb 1 u du = lim b→∞ [ ln| u | ] u=ln3 u=lnb                        = lim b→∞ ( ln| lnb |−ln| ln3 | )=∞ MathType@MTEF@5@5@@BA85@

Therefore, the series diverges.

The student response earns one of the following points:

1 point: integral
1 point: antiderivative
1 point: evaluation

u=lnx⇒du= 1 x dx ∫ 3 ∞ 1 xlnx dx= lim b→∞ ∫ 3 b 1 xlnx dx = lim b→∞ ∫ ln3 lnb 1 u du = lim b→∞ [ ln| u | ] u=ln3 u=lnb                        = lim b→∞ ( ln| lnb |−ln| ln3 | )=∞ MathType@MTEF@5@5@@BA85@

Therefore, the series diverges.

The student response earns two of the following points:

1 point: integral
1 point: antiderivative
1 point: evaluation

u=lnx⇒du= 1 x dx ∫ 3 ∞ 1 xlnx dx= lim b→∞ ∫ 3 b 1 xlnx dx = lim b→∞ ∫ ln3 lnb 1 u du = lim b→∞ [ ln| u | ] u=ln3 u=lnb                        = lim b→∞ ( ln| lnb |−ln| ln3 | )=∞ MathType@MTEF@5@5@@BA85@

Therefore, the series diverges.

The student response earns all of the following points:

1 point: integral
1 point: antiderivative
1 point: evaluation

u=lnx⇒du= 1 x dx ∫ 3 ∞ 1 xlnx dx= lim b→∞ ∫ 3 b 1 xlnx dx = lim b→∞ ∫ ln3 lnb 1 u du = lim b→∞ [ ln| u | ] u=ln3 u=lnb                        = lim b→∞ ( ln| lnb |−ln| ln3 | )=∞ MathType@MTEF@5@5@@BA85@

Therefore, the series diverges.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
The response can earn up to 2 points:
1 point: properties
1 point: explanation

The terms in this alternating series decrease in absolute value and lim x→∞ 1 nlnn =0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@43B8@ . Therefore, the Alternating Series Test guarantees that this series converges. Furthermore,

1 3ln3 − 1 4ln4 <Sum< 1 3ln3 < 1 3 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4AB0@

Therefore, the sum of the series is less than 1 3 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@37DB@ .

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
The response can earn up to 4 points:
1 point: sets up ratio
1 point: computes limit of ratio
1 point: identifies radius of convergence
1 point: analysis and interval of convergence

| ( x−2 ) n+2 ( n+1 )ln( n+1 ) ⋅ nlnn ( x−2 ) n+1 |=( n n+1 )( lnn ln( n+1 ) )| x−2 | lim n→∞ ( n n+1 )( lnn ln( n+1 ) )| x−2 |=| x−2 | | x−2 |<1⇒1<x<3 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@9F90@

When x = 1, the series is 1 3ln3 − 1 4ln4 + 1 5ln5 − 1 6ln6 +⋯ MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4C30@

This series converges by the Alternating Series Test.

When x = 3, the series is 1 3ln3 + 1 4ln4 + 1 5ln5 + 1 6ln6 +⋯ MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4C1A@

This series diverges by the integral test, as shown in part (a).

Therefore, the interval of convergence is 1 ≤ x < 3.
